node.text:
How to make a flip visual schedule using a flippable base template that works for any visual schedule icons.

First, print your visual schedule icons and the free base template.

Download the free flip visual schedule base in the Resource Library here: www.mrsdscorner.com/resource-library 

Grab the visual schedule icons seen in the video here: bit.ly/MDCvisualschedules

Then glue your visual schedule pieces in order onto the base (as shown in the video).
Next you will laminate and cut out the base.
Where you see the checkmarks, you will only cut those apart... DO NOT cut it all out. *please watch the video for this step if you are confused*.
Last, add velcro to each flip and you're good to go!

node.title: How to Make a Flip Visual Schedule

node.text:
Having a color coded system changed my classroom forever, and you can easily and effortlessly make this system work in your classroom too!

You can see more info on color coding in my IG highlight labeled "Color Coding".

You can also find the color coded IEP binders here >> bit.ly/MDCcolorcodedshop

node.title: Tips for Color Coding in ANY Classroom with Mrs. D

node.text:
Have you ever laminated alphabet stickers to use in your classroom? No?… what!?

I am about to change your spelling, writing, and alphabet identification centers forever… and save you a bunch of time in prep!

You can use these laminated stickers for so many different activities and games, like:
1. in a spelling file folder,
2. or add magnets to the back and use them on the whiteboard,
3. seriously, the possibilities are endless!

If you're more of the less-video-more-read-me type, here's the blog post >> https://www.mrsdscorner.com/lamination-hack-7/

node.text:
These lamination hacks for teachers will give you the opportunity to laminate larger items at home and more! Because I know you’re so stinkin’ excited like me, let’s get started with the 5 lamination hacks I want to share with you.

1. Use a glue stick.
2. Cut and tape your lamination pouches together to laminate larger items.
3. Tape your lamination pouches together.
4. Use multiple laminators at once!
5. Laminate cardstock to use as "whiteboards".

There are actually 2 more lamination hacks that I need to share with you... but you'll have to read about them here >> https://www.mrsdscorner.com/lamination-hacks-for-teachers/

node.title: Lamination Bootcamp • Lamination Hacks for Teachers

node.text:
I started therapy 4 years ago and my therapist changed my life. Cognitive Behavior Therapy is one of the life changing strategies I learned and use to this day.

I call it journaling, but it’s so much more than keeping a journal. It takes work. It’s not easy. But it’s worth it. You’re worth it.

Anxiety sucks, but none of us are alone in how we feel or what we’re going through. I hope this helps you as much as CBT and therapy has helped me work through my anxiety voice’s lies into healing.

Note: I am not a psychologist or psychiatrist. I am someone who lives with a mental illness and goes to therapy to work through my anxieties, and CBT is one thing that’s really helped. This information should not be construed as legal, medical, or health professional advice.

node.title: Cognitive Behavior Therapy - How I Use This Strategy for My Anxiety

node.text:
Tack-It Glue • What is it? How does it work? And will it really replace allllll the velcro?

After seeing this stuff everywhere over the last 4-5 weeks, I finally bit the bullet and bought a bottle to try. Holllyyyyy buckets!! Ya'll - this stuff is a game changer. #seriously

At the end of the video are my recommendations for what I think you could use it on... but that's just the start!

Do I think it will overall replace allllll the velcro? No... I think there are some things we will still prefer and/or need to use velcro on, but Tack-It Glue will certainly take the monetary burden of buying alllll the velcro off of us teachers!

You can find Tack-It on Amazon here >> https://amzn.to/37eCVD1 
(and full disclosure, that's an affiliate link that I earn a few pennies from if you use it to purchase, but it doesn't change the cost for you at all).

Also, I hopped in the free VIP Facebook Group earlier this afternoon to chat all about Tack-It Glue, so if you want to catch that replay head to mrsdsvips.com to join us!

node.title: Save $$ on Velcro with Tack-It • Is it true?!

node.text:
Adapted Books are so useful in any classroom, and they can easily be used during in-person or virtual learning (plus homeschool!). And today I want to share 5 big reasons why you should be using adapted books with your students.

1. Bring grade level text and topics to your students' levels and keep them actively engaged in the story.

2. Give those with very limited verbal communication an opportunity to participate more in class and feel that sense of inclusion and accomplishment.

3. Take learning into kinesthetic, build comprehension, vocabulary and key concepts, all while assessing student comprehension.

4. Quick and easy to pull out for a small group or whole group lesson to make learning interactive and engaging.

5. Motivate students to attend and participate in a lesson.

node.text:
FLIP VISUAL SCHEDULE • How to make a flip visual schedule using a flippable base template that works for any visual schedule icons.

First, print your visual schedule icons and the free base template.

• Download the free flip visual schedule base here: bit.ly/MDCreslib (at the bottom labeled “visual schedule”)
• Grab the visual schedule icons seen in the video here: bit.ly/MDCvisualschedules

Then glue your visual schedule pieces in order onto the base (as shown in the video).
Next you will laminate and cut out the base. Where you see the checkmarks, you will only cut those apart... DO NOT cut it all out. *please watch the video for this step if you are confused*.
Last, add velcro to each flip and you're good to go! 🤯You can also Velcro the visual schedule pieces on the inside instead of gluing them, ya know... because we change the schedule 716937840x per year😇 #dowhatworksforyouboo

node.title: How to Make a Flip Visual Schedule

node.text:
Imagine if you looked out at your teacher self 3 months from now and saw a teacher unscathed and overcome with clarity on the IEP writing process and a system that. How would that feel?!

With The Intentional IEP, writing IEPs has never been easier, and @theintentionaliep is open for membership for the 2020-2021 school year! We are super pumped and can't wait for you to join us.

This quick video will answer a lot of your questions and show you inside membership too.

Come sit at our table >> bit.ly/JoinTII

node.text:
FLIP VISUAL SCHEDULE • How to make a flip visual schedule using a flippable base template that works for any visual schedule icons.

First, print your visual schedule icons and the free base template.

Download the free flip visual schedule base here: bit.ly/MDCreslib (at the bottom labeled “visual schedule”) Grab the visual schedule icons seen in the video here: bit.ly/MDCvisualschedules

Then glue your visual schedule pieces in order onto the base (as shown in the video). Next you will laminate and cut out the base. Where you see the checkmarks, you will only cut those apart... DO NOT cut it all out. *please watch the video for this step if you are confused*. Last, add velcro to each flip and you're good to go🤯!

You can also Velcro the visual schedule pieces on the inside instead of gluing them, ya know... because we change the schedule 716937840x per year😇 #dowhatworksforyouboo

node.title: How to Make a Flip Visual Schedule

node.text:
Each morning during our calendar routine, my students would grab a calendar mat. This was something I created for them because even though my students weren't full off task, I wanted to make sure they were following along and actually learning during the lesson.

Enter the Calendar Mats.

What I love about this mat is the ability to differentiate it for each student, and the ability to put the pieces in any order to fit any classroom.

This is the order I chose for my classroom because it matched how we did the calendar on the front board. So as we are filling in the calendar on the front board, students are filling in, circling answers, and answering questions using the icons on the calendar mat.

After we finish calendar as whole-group, students will clean off their mats and they are told to go get “your binder” (which is their individual Morning Adapted Work Binders®).

Learn and see more at @mrsdscorner here (linked in profile) >> https://www.mrsdscorner.com/interactive-calendar-mat-for-morning-work-in-special-ed/

node.text:
MORNING ROUTINE • The first hour of our day is my favorite. ☀️ Not because I’m a morning person, but because I planned the first hour of our schedule ONCE... and it is set for the entire school year.🙌🏼
•
Not only is it differentiated to meet the needs of all students, but it’s functional and routine. It’s how we start every single morning, on day 1 and day 187.
•
The first hour can make or break the day. Especially for a substitute teacher in your classroom. And most of our students thrive on routine. #letsbereal
•
Are you ready for a stress free, planned once morning routine that meets the need of all of your students? PS. It’s in digital format too!

You can click the link in profile @mrsdscorner or go here to see an in-depth look at our first hour >> bit.ly/MDCmorningroutine

node.text:
OPEN HOUSE🏫 • Having to share so much information in a short amount of time during open house, back to school night, or meet the parent (there’s so many names for it!) can be overwhelming⏱... for you as the teacher preparing it, and for the parents on the receiving end of 12+ different papers (that they’ll probably not read and throw away #letsbereal )🗑.

So get rid of the mundane folders full of paperwork and give parents a classroom handbook they will actually use. Put a magnet on the back to allow parents the ease of storing it on a fridge - they’ll see it every day!

The best part? My sample is provided in the download to give you an example of what to put on each tab... oh yeah, it’s 100% editable too.😉 .

You can find the bestselling Editable Dual Parent Flipbook by clicking the link in profile or going here >> https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Editable-Parent-Handbook-Dual-Tab-Flip-Book--2008454

node.text:
Shark Week might be over ya'll - but we need to love every week like it’s Shark Week! What better way to prepare than by learning about what we can do as humans to save sharks.

This adapted book is included in Adapted Book Club and also available in the shop, and it's no secret that I am passionate about ocean and shark conservation - that's why all purchases of the shark bundle or individual books is donated to shark conservation efforts.

If you'd like to grab this bundle of adapted books, check the link in profile: bit.ly/MDCsharkABbundle

Thou shall not put a time limit on IEP meetings. @mrsdscorner'.

node.text:
Individualized Education Program (IEP) writing is a part of every special education teacher’s job. Our teacher lives revolve around IEPs… whether we are writing IEPs, collecting data for IEPs, updating IEPs, or implementing IEPs – if you see a special ed teacher know that an IEP is not far away.

But when it comes to writing IEPs, there are some things we should and should not do.

Enter 10 IEP Commandments.

Read more about each commandment in today's most recent blog post @mrsdscorner using the link in profile >> bit.ly/MDCiepcommandments

And for more IEP writing tips and advice, follow @theintentionaliep 😉

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Stephanie DeLussey on August 05, 2021 tagging @theintentionaliep. May be an image of text that says '10 IEP Commandments 1 Thou shall not copy and paste. Thou shall not use 80% accuracy for every IEP goal. Thou shall send a proposed draft IEP home prior to the IEP meeting. 4 Thou shall have data to back up decisions. Thou shall not put a time limit on IEP meetings. @mrsdscorner'.

Photo shared by Stephanie DeLussey on August 05, 2021 tagging @theintentionaliep. May be an image of text that says '10 IEP Commandments Thou shall write teacher training and supports into the IEP. 7 Thou shall not predetermine services. Thou shall read and understand the Procedural Safeguards. 9 Thou shall not write the IEP the night before the IEP meeting. 10 Thou sha not IEP alone. @mrsdscorner'.

node.text:
Velcro scissors😍how I love thee.

I use nonstick scissors for velcro use only, and I use a @sharpie to label them!

No one, repeat no one... is allowed to use the game changer spring loaded scissors to cut velcro. #hardno

You can find both of my favorite scissors in my Amazon shop, linked in profile >> www.amazon.com/shop/mrsdscorner
